Transcription for 462133

Well I don't know about the greatest impact. That eclipse certainly had an impact because
it just made you aware that there was more to life really than what we were familiar
with. But I think one of the things that I do remember and probably did have an impact
was when they showed pictures of children starving in Africa. That I think really,
I mean we all knew things happened, but it sort of brought it into your living room.
And when they first televised, unfortunately as time goes on, I don't say become immune
to it, but I think you have to build up a certain barrier to it. But the first ones
were really quite shocking and I think that did make an impression. So it makes you more
aware of what's going on in the world.
